articles.author: Alex Navarro
articles.description:
On May 9‚Äì10, WhiteBIT hosted the first-ever International Crypto Trading Cup (ICTC 2025)‚Äîa live-streamed global event positioning crypto trading within a competitive, real-time framework reminiscent of esports.
From a technical and developmental perspective, ICTC marked a shift: crypto trading is evolving into a spectator-based model, requiring low-latency infrastructure, robust user interfaces, and fail-safe execution environments to handle high-volume, high-stakes operations live.
ICTC 2025 hosted:
8 elite crypto traders on stage in real-time competition
12 total hours of live trading, with 269 trades executed
33 squad-based teams and ~3,000 participants worldwide


Top squad sizes: 369 and 298 members
The infrastructure had to support both professional-grade trading and a public-facing,‚Ä¶
articles.title: ICTC 2025: A Developer's Perspective on the Future of Competitive Crypto Trading

articles.author: BHUVANESH M
articles.description:
üó•Ô∏è So I was casually doomscrolling X (yes, again)... when I stumbled upon a post by DEV Community that made my brain short-circuit:
‚ú® ‚ÄúScoutDB turns plain English into MongoDB queries.‚Äù
Wait, what?!
You've got the data questions, but not always the query-fu:
"Find all users who joined after Jan 2023 and liked more than 5 posts"

Normally, you'd need to hand-craft some MongoDB incantation like:
db.users.aggregate([
  { $match: { joinDate: { $gte: ISODate("2023-01-01") }, likes: { $gt: 5 } } }
])

But what if you could skip the syntax pain?
ScoutDB is like having a friendly AI that:
‚úÖ Understands what you're trying to ask in English
explore like a boss
You type:
Show me all posts with more than 100 likes created in the last 30 days

ScoutDB replies with:
db.posts.find({
  likes: { $gt: 100 },
  createdAt: { $gte: new Date(Date.now() - 30*24*60*60*1000) }
})

Then maps the results and relationships for you in a visual explorer.
No more $lookup headaches. No more crying in JSON.
Saw this post by @ThePracticalDev on X üëá
(I swear MongoDB and ScoutDB logos look like they just agreed to rescue all devs from query hell)

üó£Ô∏è English ‚Üí MongoDB query? ‚úÖ
üß† Auto-maps your schema? ‚úÖ
üé® Visual canvas for data exploration? ‚úÖ
üß£ Found it while doomscrolling Twitter? BIG ‚úÖ
üßµ Original Post from DEV Community






üí¨ So, are you still writing $match manually or are you letting ScoutDB take the wheel?
Tell me below üëá
articles.title: Query MongoDB Like a Human with ScoutDB

articles.author: Jigar Gosar
articles.description:
Elm‚Äôs type system lets you write clear, correct code without the clutter of explicit type annotations. Its friendly compiler not only infers types automatically but also provides helpful error messages that guide you toward writing sound code. In this post, we'll explore practical examples that highlight how Elm‚Äôs type inference and compiler feedback enhance code correctness and simplify your development experience.
When coding in Elm, the compiler deduces the types of values based on their usage. This lets you focus on application logic rather than on managing repetitive type declarations.
Consider a simple arithmetic function:
square x =
    x * x

Since the multiplication operator (*) applies only to numbers, Elm infers that x must be a number. No extra annotations are needed, keeping y‚Ä¶
articles.title: Elm‚Äôs Type Inference: Crafting Sound Code with Friendly Compiler

articles.author: Mailosaur
articles.description:
When people create new accounts, it‚Äôs normal for you to need a way of contacting them with onboarding information, billing alerts, and more. That‚Äôs why having the right email address is so important.
However, what if they made a typo when providing the email address? Or they simply want to create an account without any real interest in using the service as intended? In either case you‚Äôll want to verify that they can access the email address they‚Äôve given you.
The simplest approach adopted by most is to send a unique link in an email to that address, and have a user click on that link to verify their account. It‚Äôs simple, but it works.
But how can you test this kind of workflow with Selenium?
Why can‚Äôt Selenium test this already?
While Selenium is an extremely capable tool for testing web c‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to automate email verification with Selenium

articles.author: DarkStarVue
articles.description:
Yes, this was written with the help of AI, but hear me out! Most tutorials and videos miss this detail, which is the right scope of work in the context of an AI coding tool (like Cursor, etc.). They might say, "keep it short," but what exactly is that? We've all been in a place where we go down a rabbit hole for hours and lose track. This article will help you get that under control! 
When you're working with AI in a chat window‚Äîlike building a new feature in a SaaS multi-tenant app‚Äîit‚Äôs easy to get lost in the weeds. Should you build the whole thing at once? Go step by step? Here's a practical way to scope your work, avoid rabbit holes, and get the most out of your AI assistant.
Break the feature into clear, atomic units of work that:
Are easy to explain in a paragraph or less
Produce a m‚Ä¶
articles.title: Vibe coders or new coder advice: Scope of work

articles.author: Alireza Minagar
articles.description:
Hello DEV community üëã
My name is Alireza Minagar, and I come from a rather unique background ‚Äî as a neurologist, researcher, and now a software engineering student.
After years of diagnosing complex neurological conditions, I‚Äôve begun exploring how artificial intelligence and software can revolutionize healthcare. Surprisingly, many skills from my medical background translate directly into programming.
Here are 5 lessons from neurology that shape how I now think about software engineering:
In medicine, we never treat a symptom without understanding its root cause. Debugging works the same way ‚Äî don‚Äôt guess. Investigate.
Analyzing EEGs or MRIs is about spotting patterns. Writing efficient code or identifying logical bugs requires the same cognitive muscle.
Whether prescribing medication or defining logic in code, tiny errors can lead to serious consequences. Precision builds trust ‚Äî in both healthcare and software.
Medical professionals live by notes. In code, comments, READMEs, and clear commit messages keep everything healthy and maintainable.
In both medicine and tech, decisions have real consequences. Transparent, explainable algorithms are just as vital as informed consent.
I‚Äôm currently learning Python, full-stack engineering, and bioinformatics with the goal of contributing to healthcare-focused AI solutions.
Let‚Äôs build a world where medical insight and machine logic support ‚Äî not replace ‚Äî human care.
‚Äî

Alireza Minagar, MD, MBA, MS

LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/alirezaminagar

Medium: medium.com/@aminagar_38889
articles.title: 5 Lessons from Neurology That Make Me a Better Software Engineer

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Adrian Zmudzinski
articles.description:
A lag in Tether‚Äôs wallet blacklisting process allowed over $78 million in illicit funds to be moved before enforcement actions took effect, according to a new report from blockchain compliance firm AMLBot.  
In a May 15 report, AMLBot‚Äôs onchain investigation team explained that Tether‚Äôs address blacklisting becomes effective after a considerable delay from when the process is initiated on Ethereum and Tron.
‚ÄúThis delay originates from Tether‚Äôs multisignature contract setup on both Tron and Ethereum, transforming what should be an immediate compliance action into a window of opportunity for illicit actors,‚Äú the report stated.
Tether‚Äôs blacklisting procedure is a multi-step process with a first transaction effectively warning of the upcoming blacklisting. First, a Tether administrator multis‚Ä¶
articles.title: Tether blacklist delay allowed $78M in USDT transfers, report says

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Kyrian Alex
articles.description:
After the 2024 halving, Bitcoin mining entered its fifth epoch and block rewards were reduced from 6.25 BTC to 3.125 BTC. This forced miners to rethink their operations, optimize efficiency, cut energy costs and upgrade hardware to remain profitable. Cointelegraph Research, with insights from industry experts at Uminers, examines this transformation in its latest report. The analysis covers ASIC efficiency improvements, corporate performance, geographical expansion and new revenue models. As miners adapt, Bitcoin moves into a new era where institutional momentum and sovereign adoption could redefine its role in the global financial system.
Download the full report to uncover how miners are navigating this shift and what the future holds for Bitcoin‚Äôs mining industry.
The mining industry‚Äôs ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin mining 2025: Post-halving profitability, hashrate and energy trends

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
Stablecoin issuer Tether minted another 1 billion USDt tokens on Tron, pushing the network‚Äôs authorized USDT supply to surpass Ethereum‚Äôs.
On May 15, blockchain data showed that Tether‚Äôs treasury minted $1 billion of its dollar-pegged stablecoin, USDt (USDT), into the Tron network.¬†
As of May 14, Tether‚Äôs stablecoin transparency page shows that Tron‚Äôs authorized USDT totals $73.7 billion, while Ethereum has $74.5 billion in authorized USDT tokens. If the newly minted tokens are added to the number of authorized USDT assets, Tron‚Äôs supply surpasses Ethereum‚Äôs.¬†
In terms of circulating supply, Tron also has the lead with $73.6 billion USDT on the network, while Ethereum only has $71.8 billion.¬†
Source: PeckShieldAlert
Tether‚Äôs USDT mints replenish the company‚Äôs token inventory
Tether CEO Pao‚Ä¶
articles.title: Tron‚Äôs USDT supply to surpass Ethereum‚Äôs with new $1B mint

Propelling brands to take a deeper look at digital merch is the desire to better un‚Ä¶

On this week‚Äôs episode of The Clear Crypto Podcast, hosts Nathan Jeffay and Gareth Jenkinson sit down with Isabel Foxen Duke, general partner at Unbroken Chain and longtime Bitcoin advocate, to unpack what she calls ‚ÄúBitcoin Season 2.‚Äù

Bitcoin beyond money
‚ÄúBitcoin Season 2 is really about seeing what we can do with Bitcoin outside of just being money,‚Äù said Duke. 
‚ÄúWhat are the broad range of financial use cases for [Bitcoin] other than just being money by itself?‚Äù
New developments like ordinals, runes, and decentralized financial (DeFi) tools are pushing Bitcoin beyond its traditional identity as a digital store of value. 
One key innovation under discussion is trustless lending ‚Äî allowing users to borrow agai‚Ä¶

articles.description:
Prominent short-seller Jim Chanos, once a vocal critic of Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies, revealed a new trading play that involves shorting shares of Strategy (formerly MicroStrategy) and buying Bitcoin.
At the Sohn Investment Conference in New York, Chanos told CNBC he‚Äôs ‚Äúselling MicroStrategy stock and buying Bitcoin.‚Äù The investor described the move as buying something for $1 and selling something for $2.50, referring to what he sees as a significant price mismatch.
Chanos argued that Strategy is selling the idea of buying Bitcoin (BTC) in a corporate structure, and that other companies are following suit in hopes of receiving a similar market premium.
Chanos said this was ‚Äúridiculous.‚Äù He described his trade as ‚Äúa good barometer of not only just the arbitrage itself, but I think of reta‚Ä¶

articles.description:
Cryptocurrencies and stablecoins are gaining recognition in the traditional finance (TradFi) space for their ability to streamline payments and increase efficiency in existing financial systems
In finance, collateral management refers to the process of managing the underlying collateral securing other financial transactions, such as loans or derivatives, to mitigate credit risks and ensure smooth transactions.
Digital assets like stablecoins are the ‚Äúperfect‚Äù financial instrument for real-time collateral management, according to a recent pilot by DTCC Digital Assets, which suggests that digital assets, particularly stablecoins, could modernize and simplify this critical function.
‚ÄúDigital assets really are the perfect use case for collateral management, whether it be uncleared derivatives,‚Ä¶
articles.title: Stablecoins seen as ideal fit for real-time collateral management

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Zoltan Vardai
articles.description:
Coinbase, the world‚Äôs third-largest cryptocurrency exchange, was hit by a $20 million extortion attempt after cybercriminals recruited overseas support agents to leak user data, the company said.
According to a May 15 blog post, Coinbase said a group of external actors bribed and coordinated with several customer support contractors to access internal systems and steal limited user account data.
‚ÄúThese insiders abused their access to customer support systems to steal the account data for a small subset of customers,‚Äù Coinbase said, adding that no passwords, private keys, funds or Coinbase Prime accounts were affected.
Less than 1% of Coinbase‚Äôs monthly transacting users‚Äô data was affected by the attack, the company said.
Source: Coinbase
After stealing the data, the attackers attempted to ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Coinbase faces $400M bill after insider phishing attack

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Sam Bourgi
articles.description:
Private credit marketplace Pareto has introduced a new synthetic dollar aimed at linking institutional investors with decentralized finance (DeFi) opportunities ‚Äî a move that highlights the expanding role of stablecoins in global finance.
The newly launched USP synthetic dollar is fully backed by real-world private credit, Pareto told Cointelegraph on May 15. To mint USP, users must deposit stablecoins such as USDC (USDC) and USDt (USDT), which are then held as collateral.
‚ÄúUSP is backed 1:1 by the stablecoins used during the minting process,‚Äù Pareto co-founder Matteo Pandolfi told Cointelegraph in a written statement.
The deposited funds are placed into Pareto‚Äôs credit vaults and lent to what the company describes as ‚Äúvetted institutional borrowers,‚Äù generating yields for participants.
To‚Ä¶
articles.title: Pareto launches synthetic dollar backed by private credit

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Zoltan Vardai
articles.description:
Ukraine is reportedly moving closer to adopting Bitcoin as a national reserve asset, a move that could bolster its financial resilience amid the ongoing war with Russia.  
Lawmakers are reportedly working on a Bitcoin (BTC) national reserve proposal, with a draft bill in its final stages, according to Yaroslav Zhelezniak, a member of parliament who confirmed the plan to local media outlet Incrypted.
The proposal was announced during the CRYPTO 2025 conference in Kyiv on Feb. 6. ‚ÄúWe will soon submit a draft law from the industry allowing the creation of crypto reserves,‚Äù Zhelezniak said.
Cointelegraph reached out to Zhelezniak for comment on the bill‚Äôs status but had not received a response by publication.
Related: Bitcoin treasury firms driving $200T hyperbitcoinization ‚Äî Adam Back
Bitcoin‚Ä¶
articles.title: Ukraine strategic Bitcoin reserve bill reportedly in final stages

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Arunkumar Krishnakumar
articles.description:
What is HTTP 402, and why does it matter?            
            
                
The web was not really built with payments in mind, especially not for autonomous agents or machines. But with the rise of AI and decentralized finance (DeFi), the need for seamless, native digital payments has never been more urgent.¬†
Coinbase x402 announced a new open protocol designed to let APIs, apps and AI agents pay instantly using stablecoins like USDC (USDC), all via the familiar HTTP protocol.
This isn‚Äôt just a product update. X402 revives a long-forgotten piece of internet infrastructure and reimagines it for a future powered by agentic systems and crypto.
HTTP status codes: A quick refresher
Understanding HTTP status codes helps clarify how the web communicates behind the scenes. Here are some k‚Ä¶
articles.title: Coinbase‚Äôs x402: Crypto payments over HTTP for AI and APIs

articles.description:
Publicly traded company BTCS announced a $57.8 million financing agreement led by investment firm ATW Partners to purchase Ether as it expands its blockchain infrastructure strategy.¬†
The Rockville, Maryland-based company announced the deal on May 14, saying that the move will allow it to expand validator node operations and build recurring revenue from Ether (ETH) staking.
BTCS CEO Charles Allen said the move follows Strategy‚Äôs (formerly MicroStrategy) high-profile Bitcoin (BTC) accumulation blueprint and will leverage Ethereum for long-term growth.¬†
‚ÄúWe are executing a disciplined strategy to increase our Ethereum exposure and drive recurring revenue through staking and our block building operations,‚Äù Allen said.
Source: BTCS
BTCS issues initial $7.8 million convertible notes
As part of ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Nasdaq-listed BTCS to boost ETH holdings with $57.8M raise

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Yat Siu
articles.description:
Opinion by: Yat Siu, executive chairman and co-founder, Animoca Brands
A discussion on digital property rights, copyright, intellectual property, the open metaverse, AI and value without physical form.
When I attend conferences and similar public events, someone almost always approaches me to ask how cryptographic tokens (fungible or non-fungible) can have value even though tokens are virtual and do not exist in the physical world. It's a surprisingly common question, especially one-on-one.
Virtual objects like NFTs and cryptocurrencies are both digital and intangible; their existence is not based in the real (physical) world, and (unlike digital currencies) they generally do not have backing by real-world institutions.¬†
The ability to have value (specifically, monetary worth) is crucially‚Ä¶
articles.title: The value of virtual: Economies are powered by ownership of the intangible

Bitcoin (BTC) is poised for expansion with BTC price action rarely more ‚Äúbullish-looking,‚Äù an analyst says.
In his latest commentary on X, market analyst filbfilb revealed a key support battle now underway on BTC/USD.
Filbfilb on $100,000 battle: ‚ÄúThis time is no different‚Äù
Bitcoin has begun to consolidate after making rapid gains this month, with the area just north of $100,000 seeing ‚Äúchoppy‚Äù BTC price moves.
For filbfilb, however, current market behavior is about more than reclaiming six fig‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin looks ‚Äòridiculous‚Äô as bulls attempt $2T market cap flip ‚Äî Analyst

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Nancy Lubale
articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Ether‚Äôs price fell over 4% to $2,575 on May 15, mirroring similar downward moves across the wider cryptocurrency market.

Long liquidations and a drop in open interest facilitated ETH‚Äôs drop.

‚ÄúOverbought‚Äù RSI and technical resistance signal profit-taking.

Ether (ETH) price declined by over 4% in the last 24 hours to around $2,575 on May 15. ETH‚Äôs drop mirrored similar downside moves elsewhere in the cryptocurrency market, with the total capitalization falling by approximately 2.40% to $3.3 trillion.
ETH/USD four-hour chart. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView
Let‚Äôs look at some of the factors driving Ether‚Äôs price down today.
ETH price down as long liquidated, and OI falls 
Ether‚Äôs open interest (OI) has decreased by 4.5% to $31.52 billion over the last 24 hours, according ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Why is Ethereum (ETH) price down today?

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
Several investors in a non-fungible token (NFT) project, Hashling NFT, have accused its founder of misappropriating millions of dollars in profits from the project and a closely tied Bitcoin mining operation.
According to the May 14 court filing in Illinois, the plaintiffs allege that their former business partner, Jonathan Mills, lied about transferring assets from Hashling NFT and at least $3 million from the Bitcoin mining project to a holding company ‚Äî Satoshi Labs LLC (formerly known as Proof of Work Labs LLC), which Mills is the founder and CEO of.
The plaintiffs have sued Mills for fraud and breach of fiduciary duty, claiming that they have not received any of the equity returns that he supposedly promised.¬†
They also claim to have raised a combined $1.46 million from two NFT drops ‚Ä¶
articles.title: NFT founder stole millions from Bitcoin project, investors allege

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
A Singapore High Court has ruled in favor of Sonic Labs‚Äô motion to force the Multichain Foundation to wind up in an effort to recover funds stolen during a 2023 hack.
In the May 9 judgment in the Singapore Supreme Court, Justice Kwek Mean Luck granted a request from Sonic Labs, formerly the Fantom Foundation, to declare Multichain bankrupt and appoint liquidators from global audit, tax and advisory service KPMG.
Sonic Labs CEO Michael Kong said in a May 14 statement to X that the team behind the layer 1 Sonic blockchain felt it had no choice but to file a lawsuit to forcibly wind up Multichain because its former employees were being ‚Äúcompletely uncooperative‚Äù and ‚Äúhid from victims.‚Äù
‚ÄúGoing forward, the liquidators can now start working with other parties to initiate the process of trying t‚Ä¶
articles.title: Sonic Labs wins judgment for Multichain Foundation to wind up

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Jesse Coghlan
articles.description:
The US Senate could pass a key bipartisan stablecoin bill as soon as next week after removing language targeting President Donald Trump and his family‚Äôs sprawling crypto interests.
Republican Senator Cynthia Lummis said onstage at an event by Coinbase‚Äôs lobbying arm, Stand With Crypto, that she thinks it's a ‚Äúfair target‚Äù to have the Guiding and Establishing National Innovation for US Stablecoins Act, or GENIUS Act, passed by May 26 ‚Äî Memorial Day in the US.
Joining her onstage was Democratic Senator Kirsten Gillibrand, who hinted that the bill‚Äôs language was changed to scrap provisions that targeted Trump‚Äôs various crypto projects, which include memecoins, a crypto platform, a stablecoin and a crypto mining company that plans to go public, among others.
‚ÄúWhen this language comes out, peop‚Ä¶
articles.title: Senate removes Trump provisions in push to pass stablecoin bill

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
A major Chinese darknet marketplace suspected of facilitating crypto scams and cybercrime has been shut down by the Telegram messaging service, upon which it operated.
The internet‚Äôs largest illicit marketplace, Haowang Guarantee, formerly Huione Guarantee, said it will shut down following Telegram‚Äôs ban of thousands of associated accounts on May 13.¬†
‚ÄúSince all our NFTs, channels and groups were blocked by Telegram on May 13, 2025, Haowang Guarantee will cease operations from now on,‚Äù read the notice on the marketplace website.
A report from Wired said that this involved banning thousands of accounts and usernames that served as the infrastructure for the crypto crime marketplace and its vendors.
Telegram spokesperson Remi Vaughn told the outlet, ‚Äúcommunities previously reported to us by ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Telegram shuts ‚Äòlargest darknet marketplace to have ever existed‚Äô

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
Some criminal organizations are yet to receive the memo ‚Äî crypto is traceable ‚Äî and could explain the recent string of crypto-related kidnappings, says Chainalysis CEO Jonathan Levin.¬†
Law enforcement has been increasingly successful at tracing stolen funds and crypto ransom payments, resulting in a ‚Äúlot of arrests,‚Äù Levin said during the 2025 Consensus crypto conference, covered by Cointelegraph.
‚ÄúFor whatever reason, there is a perception that‚Äôs out there that crypto is an asset that is untraceable, and that really lends itself to criminals acting in a certain way,‚Äù he said.¬†
‚ÄúApparently, the know that crypto is not untraceable hasn't been received by some of the organized crime groups that are actually perpetrating these attacks, and some of them are concentrated in, you know, France, b‚Ä¶
articles.title: Chainalysis CEO offers a clue into recent spate of Paris crypto attacks

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong says his firm will continue to look for merger and acquisition opportunities after acquiring crypto derivatives platform Deribit.
‚ÄúWe are always looking at M&A opportunities,‚Äù said Armstrong on Bloomberg Television on May 14.
He added that the firm has a large balance sheet that can be put to use.
The firm revealed in its latest revenue report that its balance sheet has strengthened, ending the first quarter with $9.9 billion in US dollar resources.
‚ÄúPart of the benefit of being a public company is, you have a liquid currency to do that,‚Äù he said, adding: ‚ÄúWe are looking at acquisition opportunities; doesn‚Äôt mean we swing at every pitch. We want it to be the right opportunity.‚Äù
On May 8, the firm announced that it agreed to acquire crypto options trading platfo‚Ä¶
articles.title: Coinbase eyes more deals after $2.9B Deribit acquisition

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
European law enforcement in January arrested 17 suspects of a ‚Äúmafia crypto bank‚Äù  who are said to have laundered over 21 million euros ($23.5 million) in crypto for criminal entities in China and the Middle East.
The money laundering services were allegedly carried out on behalf of other criminal networks engaged in migrant smuggling and drug trafficking, Europol said in a May 14 statement.
Spanish authorities said the criminal organization ran a secret informal money transfer system called hawala and was often compensated in crypto.
A total of 17 individuals were arrested ‚Äî 15 in Spain, one in Austria and one in Belgium ‚Äî while 4.5 million euros ($5 million) worth of items were seized, including cash, crypto, 18 vehicles, four shotguns and several electronic devices.
Of the 4.5 million e‚Ä¶
articles.title: Europol helps dismantle $23M ‚Äòmafia crypto bank‚Äô

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
US Democrat lawmakers have sent a letter to the US Treasury demanding access to suspicious activity reports (SARs) on several Trump-backed crypto projects as part of the latest probe into the president‚Äôs digital ventures.¬†
Penned by representatives Gerald Connolly, Joseph Morelle, and Jamie Raskin, the May 14 letter asks Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent for all SARS filed since 2023 related to World Liberty Financial (WLF) and the Official Trump (TRUMP) token.¬†
Financial institutions in the US must file SARs with the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network, a bureau within the Department of the Treasury, when they detect suspicious activity, including potential money laundering or fraud.¬†
Source: Oversight Committee Democrats
The sweeping probe asks for any SARs mentioning WinRed, America PAC‚Ä¶
articles.title: Democrats seek suspicious activity reports linked to Trump crypto ventures

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Jesse Coghlan
articles.description:
Update (May 15, 2:12 am UTC): This article has been updated to add a comment from eToro Australia‚Äôs Robert Francis.
Crypto and stock trading platform eToro has seen its share price gain nearly 30% during its debut on the Nasdaq after the company made a last-minute boost to its initial public offering.
Shares in eToro Group Ltd (ETOR) closed May 14 trading at $67, up 28.9% from its initial offering price of $52, according to Yahoo Finance. It brings the company‚Äôs market value to over $5.5 billion.
Its stock price shot to a high of $74.26 during the trading day before cooling and has also slightly dipped by 0.7% after the bell to $66.53.
EToro shares shot up and then traded sideways on the company‚Äôs debut US offering. Source: Yahoo Finance
The day before, on May 13, eToro boosted its IPO to ‚Ä¶
articles.title: eToro jumps 30% on Nasdaq debut after upsized IPO

articles.author: George Tebrean
articles.description: The Linux Foundation‚Äôs Decentralized Trust (LFDT) mentorship program is back in 2025 with two exciting opportunities for developers passionate about Ethereum, Android, and the Java Virtual Machine (JVM). Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned blockchain developer or an Android enthusiast eager to dive into Web3, these mentorships offer
articles.title: Join the 2025 Web3j Mentorships: Build the Future of Ethereum on the JVM
